SUMMARY: NESTED | FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD DETAIL: FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD

org.araneaframework.backend.util
Class BeanUtil

java.lang.Object
  org.araneaframework.backend.util.BeanUtil

public class BeanUtil
extends Object

This class provides methods to manipulate Bean fields. Simple (e.g. 'name') as well as nested (e.g. 'location.city') Bean fields are both supported. Empty nested properties are automatically attempted to be initiated.

When accessing field the following approach is used:

  1. If there is public accessor in bean's class or any superclass, then use it.
  2. If there is declared field with any access modifier in bean's class, then use it.

Author:
Rein Raudj√§rv (rein@araneaframework.org), Nikita Salnikov-Tarnovski (nikem@webmedia.ee), Martti Tamm (martti@araneaframework.org)
See Also:
BeanMapper

Constructor Detail

BeanUtil

public BeanUtil()
Method Detail

getProperties

public static List<String> getProperties(Class<?> beanClass)
Provides a list of bean properties that can be read or written to by this BeanUtil. Only simple fields (not nested) are returned.

Parameters:
beanClass - the class implementing the Bean pattern.
Returns:
List<String>- the List of Bean field names.

getPropertyValue

public static Object getPropertyValue(Object bean,
                                      String property)
Provides the value of bean property (identified by property). Returns null if no bean specified or such method/field found.

Parameters:
bean - The bean for which the property value must be returned.
property - The name of bean property. May be nested.
Returns:
The value of the bean property.

setPropertyValue

public static void setPropertyValue(Object bean,
                                    String property,
                                    Object value)
Sets the value of bean property (identified by property) to the given value. If the property is a nested path and a nested property is null, an attempt is made to initiate it.

Parameters:
bean - Object for which the property value must be set.
property - The name of bean property. May be nested.
value - The value of the bean property must have.

setPropertyValue

public static void setPropertyValue(Object bean,
                                    String property,
                                    Object value,
                                    boolean createMissingBeans)
Sets the value of bean property (identified by property) to the given value. The createMissingBeans parameter controls whether nested null properties should be initiated and set when traversing.

Parameters:
bean - Object for which the property value must be set.
property - The name of bean property. May be nested.
value - The value of the bean property must have.
createMissingBeans - A boolean indicating that, if property is nested, all null properties should be instantiated (by default: true).
Since:
2.0

getPropertyType

public static Class<?> getPropertyType(Class<?> beanClass,
                                       String property)
Provides the type class of the given bean property.

Parameters:
beanClass - Object class for which the property data type must be returned.
property - The name of bean property. May be nested.
Returns:
The data type of the bean property.

isReadableProperty

public static boolean isReadableProperty(Class<?> beanClass,
                                         String property)
Provides whether this BeanUtil can read the given bean property.

Parameters:
bean - Object for which the property must be resolved.
property - The name of bean property. May be nested.
Returns:
Whether the bean property is readable.

isWritableProperty

public static boolean isWritableProperty(Class<?> beanClass,
                                         String property)
Provides whether this BeanUtil can write to the given bean property.

Parameters:
beanClass - Object class for which the property must be resolved.
property - The name of bean property. May be nested.
Returns:
Whether the bean property is writable.

newInstance

public static <T> T newInstance(Class<T> beanClass)
Creates new instance of the specified beanClass.

In order to be Bean type, it must have a constructor without arguments.

If creating the new instance fails, a RuntimeException is thrown.

Parameters:
beanClass - the class implementing the Bean pattern.
Returns:
new instance of the Bean type.

copy

public static Object copy(Object from,
                          Object to)
Sets all the fields with same names to same values.

NB! the values are references (there'is no deep copy made)!

from Bean fields that are not supported by to are ignored.

Parameters:
from - Bean from which to convert.
to - Bean to which to convert.
Returns:
to with values
See Also:
copy(Object, Class)

copy

public static Object copy(Object from,
                          Class<?> toType)
Creates a new instance of Class toType and sets its field values to be the same as given from Object. Only fields with same names that exist in both from object and toType class are affected.

Parameters:
from - Bean from which to read field values.
toType - Class which object instance to create.
Returns:
new instance of toType with from values
See Also:
copy(Object, Object), Object.clone()

clone

public static Object clone(Object bean)
Clones bean by copying its fields values (references) to a new instance of the same type.

Parameters:
bean - bean Object, which value to set.
Returns:
new instance of bean type with same fields values (references)
See Also:
copy(Object, Object), copy(Object, Class)
